title: Data Gathering
question_text:
Which of the following statements are true in regards to gathering data?
I. A census attempts to contact every individual from the sample.
II. An observational study is different from an experiment in that a treatment is imposed in an observational study.
III. A matched pairs experiment can reduce variability.
solution:
Statement I is incorrect; a census attempts to contact everybody in the population, not just a sample of the population.

Statement II is incorrect; treatments are imposed in experiments but NOT in observational studies.

Statement III is correct; matched pairs experiments either pair people together by similarity or test an individual against themselves, reducing variability in results.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
